paper_metadata.title: Genomic Screening for Pathogenic Transthyretin Variants Finds Evidence of Underdiagnosed Amyloid Cardiomyopathy From Health Records
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the TTR gene, including penetrance data and individual patient information.

patients.demographics: Median age 52 [Q1-Q3: 37–61] years; 43% male; approximately 60% had African ancestry.
patients.phenotype: Increased odds of heart disease, limited diagnoses of amyloidosis.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One individual (1 of 157 patients; 0.64%) with a P/LP TTR variant (T60A) had an existing diagnosis of cardiac amyloidosis.
Two individuals (2 of 157; 1.3%) with a P/LP TTR variant (T60A [same patient as above] and V122I) had a diagnosis of noncardiac-specific (general) amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: No specific functional data provided in the paper.

variants.population_frequency: V122I variant observed in 91 of 3,459 individuals with African ancestry (2.6%).
variants.additional_notes: The majority of individuals with P/LP TTR variants were heterozygous.
key_quotes: Individuals with P/LP TTR variants identified by genomic screening have increased odds of heart disease after age 60 years.
Approximately 60% (n = 91) of individuals with P/LP TTR variants (all V122I) had African ancestry.

tables_processed.table_caption: Observed P/LP Variants in TTR in MyCode (N = 157)
